issue.title: Delay doesn't work in interaction with Flight Modes
issue.body: When Delay is set on any mixer line, if any Flight Mode is unchecked, Delay won't work, no matter what the currently active Flight Mode actually is.

forkee.name: opentx
forkee.description: OpenTX custom firmware for Transmitters, port to Radiolink AT series

issue.title: Horus Access - receiver option displayed with "typo"/missing character
issue.body:
When displaying the options for a ACCESS bound RXSR receiver it is written " rotocol" rather than "Protocol".
Please see attached pictures from 2 different RXSR. However, I dont know (yet) whether its an issue of RXSR or any other ACCESS receiver as well.

OpenTX 2.3.14 on Horus

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55102433/149773318-9f31f096-45fc-4345-b1e1-4ef735d3f5eb.png)

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55102433/149773358-d3ff006a-5981-4991-9a2e-5bd49a2e557b.png)

commits.message: Allows flashing OTA all recent FrSky receivers

issue.title: Ease up telemetry setting in Horus
issue.body:
Setting up telemetry settings in a Horus transmitter is a mess. And Companion does not help here. As this probably is due to good reason, it may is possible to provide some help to ease up the pain. Something which helps if you just what to have a starting point and if you have no certain requirements. Stuff like ...

- some "Click Button" which simply spreads all available sensor values among several telemetry pages? No options to choose, just quick and dirty one page for each sensor and all its values.
- backing up the Telemetry settings for a model in companion. If one accidently changes the Widget-Layout in the transmitter and all is lost, it can be restored without overwriting the major settings for a model.
- exporting a telemetry page from _Companion_? This Telemetry page might be imported back to a different model. You only need to do some adjustments but you would save quite some clicks.

I would realy appreciate some little helpershelper to work with a Horus. At least as long as there is no comprehensive config helper as we have it for _Taranis_ (which is just great).

Thx for thinking about it :-)

comment.body: Closing as it is obviously not of interest for anybody.

issue.title: Throttle Warning for a Centered Throttle
issue.body:
Cars and Ships are usually capable to move backwards and Zero-Gas  is at neutral position. It would be usefull to have a _Throttle Warning_ for throttle not being in center/neutral position.
I think of something like a check box named _Centered Throttle_ at the _Model Setup Screen_ right beside the _Reverse Throttle_ check mark.

Especially if you have airplane models on the same transmittter and you change model from an Airplane to e.g. a Ship,  it happens rather often that the Throttle is way down which is usually zero for planes. It would be great to have a _Throttle Warning_ in that case.

comment.body:
As I started this issue, I am closing it now. After 3 years I dont think that it is of relevance for anybody. I migrated to ETX 2..9.1 and it works perfectly there. 
If anyone think it would be helpful for some reason, feel free to reopen it.

issue.title: X9D+ SE 2019 and multimodule communication cut off with SF switch when openTX >= 2.3.12
issue.body:
Hi, 

I have a Taranis X9D+ SE 2019 (openTX 2.3.14) and an iRangeX IRX4+ multimodule (firmware 1.3.6)
I'm facing a fairly critical issue of communication cut off between radio and module.

In serial mode (MULTI), communication between the radio and the multimodule cuts off under reproducible circumstances as follows :
- radio is using external RF 
- communication between radio and module is set in serial mode (MULTI)
- receiver doesn't need to be on (though problem may appear quicker when receiver is on, but not sure of this point)
- after several toggles of the 2-positions switch SF (random number of toggles, that can be one or ten, rarely more than a few tens) the communication between the radio and the multimodule cuts off (the radio says "No serial input" and the red led flashes slowly on the multimodule)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9478418/143895294-a130a1f3-ba6e-49ca-9fd3-125d161386b2.png)

I posted this issue to RC Groups thread and it appears that this is not an isolated case, it seems to be related to using multimodule inside X9D+ SE 2019, please [see here](https://www.rcgroups.com/forums/showpost.php?p=48240461&postcount=23142).

[Old openTX versions](https://www.rcgroups.com/forums/showpost.php?p=48249615&postcount=23150) for X9D+ SE 2019 have been posted on the same thread so I could try and see if issue is still there.

Here are the results of my tests : 
- openTX 2.3.13 : issue is present
- openTX 2.3.12 : issue is present
- openTX 2.3.11 : no issue detected
- openTX 2.3.10 : no issue detected
- openTX <= 2.3.9 : not tested

So it seems to me that the issue appeared with openTX 2.3.12 and is there since.

Thanks for your help. Best regards.

Remark : no issue with another switch than SF, no issue with PPM communication mode, no issue with SF switch when using internal RF, no issue with an X9D, seems specific to X9D+ SE 2019 + multimodule + serial mode + SF switch

issue.title: plausibility check for telemetry values
issue.body:
It would be nice if OTX can check the plausibility of a telemetry value, before processing it.

Sample:
Once in while it happens that the distance or heigh value from my GPS sensor (FrSky) is showing useless values. Instead of a distance, like e.g. 312m, suddenly I have like 
12371m or 20629m displayed. Just some strange value which probably occured due to a transmission failure. And now such a value makes it into Maximum/Minimum scores and as well into the logs.
And all happens while the telemetry basically continue to work fine, including GPS distances.

In reality it will never happen that a reasonable distance change is more than a couple of 10m among a measurement period. OTX may can check whether a telemetry value makes sense at all and may even in comparison to the last value(s). If a value is not sensefull, it can simple be dropped and does not pollute logs and statistics.

comment.body: The file I joined clearly shows that the problem is not the sensor sending crap, but miscalculation. Please have a look at this problem.

- radio is using external RF 
- communication between radio and module is set in serial mode (MULTI)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9478418/143895294-a130a1f3-ba6e-49ca-9fd3-125d161386b2.png)

I posted this issue to RC Groups thread and it appears that this is not an isolated case, it seems to be related to using multimodule inside X9D+ SE 2019, please [see here](https://www.rcgroups.com/forums/showpost.php?p=48240461&postcount=23142).

comment.body:
What version of Linux are you using?  I'm use openSUSE 15.4,
I would first compile 2.3.12 and make sure it still fails .
git tag will give you the tags so "git checkout release/2.3.12" should get you 2.3.12.

Looking at https://github.com/opentx/opentx/blob/2.3/tools/boards.py it looks like    you need -DBCB=X(D+ -DPCBREV=2019 

I would not do a debug build at this point, I would do a release build to match what you are downloading  and verify it fails when built with your environment 
-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RELEASE.

While you can do a make all you only need to do make -JX firmware (where X is the number of  computer cores to use to compile - the more you use the faster the compile).  

"git help bisect" will tell you how to use it.

issue.title: plausibility check for telemetry values
issue.body:
It would be nice if OTX can check the plausibility of a telemetry value, before processing it.

Sample:
Once in while it happens that the distance or heigh value from my GPS sensor (FrSky) is showing useless values. Instead of a distance, like e.g. 312m, suddenly I have like 
12371m or 20629m displayed. Just some strange value which probably occured due to a transmission failure. And now such a value makes it into Maximum/Minimum scores and as well into the logs.
And all happens while the telemetry basically continue to work fine, including GPS distances.

In reality it will never happen that a reasonable distance change is more than a couple of 10m among a measurement period. OTX may can check whether a telemetry value makes sense at all and may even in comparison to the last value(s). If a value is not sensefull, it can simple be dropped and does not pollute logs and statistics.

comment.body: I have started this issue, but I am not anymore interested in a solution. Since @Rotoryfr provided a contribution, I leave it up to him to keep the issue open or close it.

comment.body:
Ok, so I am guessing that the docker bulld envt is obsolete.

This page gave me some insight :
https://www.rcgroups.com/forums/showthread.php?3824801-Blog-1-Step-by-step-guide-to-building-%28custom%29-OpenTX-firmware-under-Ubuntu-Linux

I have done some hacking around:

   - installed the Arm Gnu Toolchain:
      - followed instructions here:
      https://lindevs.com/install-arm-gnu-toolchain-on-ubuntu
   - installed dfu-util cmake :
      - $ sudo apt install dfu-util cmake
      - cloned the opentx 2.3 branch:
      - $ mkdir TEMP_ARM
      - $ git clone --recursive -b 2.3 https://github.com/opentx/opentx.git
      - $ cd opentx
      - $ mkdir build_00
      - $ cd build_00
      - tried to execute cmake with some options from
   https://github.com/opentx/opentx/wiki/OpenTX-2.2-Linux-Build-Instructions
      - $ cmake -DPCB=X9D+ -DGVARS=YES -DLUA=YES -DDEBUG=YES
      -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug ../
      - but got lots of errors about missing qt files
   - installed what I thought were the missing qtfiles including:
   qtmultimedia5-dev  and lots of others
   - tried the cmake again
      - $ cmake -DPCB=X9D+ -DGVARS=YES -DLUA=YES -DDEBUG=YES
      -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug ../
      - seemed to work! no errors
   - checked the results:
      - $ cmake -LH ../ > dev-cmake-options.txt
      - $ cat dev-cmake-options.txt
      $ more dev-cmake-options.txt
      -- OpenTX 2.3.15 @656fec93
      -- Python found, version: 3.10.12
      -- Qt Version: 5.15.3
      -- Found FOX: /usr/include/fox-1.6
      -- Foxlib found at /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libFOX-1.6.so
      -- Found SDL: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libSDL.so (found version
      "1.2.15")
      -- SDL Lib: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libSDL.so; Headers:
      /usr/include/SDL; Version: 1.2.15
      -- Googletest will be downloaded
      -- Added optional gtests target
      -- Simulators library search path: /usr/local/lib/companion23
      -- Added optional gtests-companion target
      -- install /home/bob/TEMP_ARM/opentx/build_00 to /usr/local/bin
      -- Configuring done
      -- Generating done
      -- Build files have been written to:
      /home/bob/TEMP_ARM/opentx/build_00
      -- Cache values
      [etc]
   - tried to make it after looking at the targets in the Makefile with
   'make help'
      - $ make all
      - no errrors, but no firmware
      - $ make firmware
      - no errors:
   - this is the content of the directory after the make all and make
   firmware
   total 201588
   drwxrwxr-x  5 bob bob      4096 oct.  19 12:22 .
   drwxrwxr-x 13 bob bob      4096 oct.  19 11:34 ..
   -rw-rw-r--  1 bob bob     29542 oct.  19 12:08 CMakeCache.txt
   drwxrwxr-x  8 bob bob      4096 oct.  19 12:21 CMakeFiles
   -rw-rw-r--  1 bob bob      1891 oct.  19 11:45 cmake_install.cmake
   drwxrwxr-x  3 bob bob      4096 oct.  19 11:38 companion
   -rwxrwxr-x  1 bob bob 122792592 oct.  19 12:20 companion23
   -rw-r--r--  1 bob bob      3773 oct.  19 11:45 CPackConfig.cmake
   -rw-r--r--  1 bob bob      4193 oct.  19 11:45 CPackSourceConfig.cmake
   -rw-rw-r--  1 bob bob     10046 oct.  19 12:08 dev-cmake-options.txt
   -rw-rw-r--  1 bob bob     32768 oct.  19 12:21 eeprom.bin
   -rwxrwxr-x  1 bob bob    453372 oct.  19 12:21 firmware.bin
   -rwxrwxr-x  1 bob bob   6241424 oct.  19 12:21 firmware.elf
   -rwxrwxr-x  1 bob bob   8492960 oct.  19 12:13
   libopentx-x9d+-simulator.so
   -rw-rw-r--  1 bob bob     48963 oct.  19 12:09 Makefile
   drwxrwxr-x  3 bob bob      4096 oct.  19 11:35 radio
   -rwxrwxr-x  1 bob bob   6944504 oct.  19 12:13 simu
   -rwxrwxr-x  1 bob bob  61321008 oct.  19 12:20 simulator23
   -rw-rw-r--  1 bob bob       307 oct.  19 11:38 version.h
   - And this is the content of version.h:
   $ cat version.h
   #define VERSION           "2.3.15"
   #define VERSION_MAJOR     2
   #define VERSION_MINOR     3
   #define VERSION_REVISION  15
   #define VERSION_SUFFIX    ""

   #define VERSION_NUMBER    ((VERSION_MAJOR << 16) | (VERSION_MINOR << 8)
   | VERSION_REVISION)

   #define SIMULATOR_LIB_SEARCH_PATH  "/usr/local/lib/companion23"

So, now I am capable of building firmware.

Now, what I need:

   - *Which options* to choose to get the correct firmware for my Frsky
   Taranis X9D Plus 2019 SE, with LBT, i.e.  fix this line:
      - cmake -DPCB=X9D+ -DGVARS=YES -DLUA=YES -DDEBUG=YES
      -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug ../
   - How to use git to *select the propper files* to get the version 2.3.11
   then 2.3.12 ?
   - *How to use git bisect *exactly?
   - How to use* the output of git bisect to select new file sets* for
   building?

This is all a result of Jim Taylor's suggestion, Thank you Jim!

If possible, I would really appreciate a little help with the cmake options
and the git commands, if anyone has a minute?

Cheers,
Bob

issue.title: Companion occasionally crashes on MAC OSX
issue.body:
I experience those occasionally crashes since I work with Companion. So the problem exists at least for about 2 years.
This happens on MAC OSX Mojave, but also on earlier Versions. Companion 2.3.14 is affected but also earlier versions (unsure about 2.2).

_Companion_ just crashes all of a sudden. No error message, no sophisticated actions before. Just regular common work with e.g. editing a model. However, I feel like this only happens if _Companion_ runs on a secondary external monitor which is attached to my _MacBook Pro (late 2015)_. At least it never happened when _Companion_ runs in my LapTops monitor.
Once it is crashed, it simply can be restarted and it is fine again (for a while).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open Companion 
2. move on a secondary, external monitor
3. Simply start to edit a model ...

The closest which I assume to be of help is the following line in system.log:
_Sep 18 09:44:11 MacBro com.apple.xpc.launchd[1] (org.opentx.companion.17120[38711]): Service exited due to SIGSEGV_

Next time, I will have a timely close eye on all log file and hopefully can provide more.

The functionality of _Companion_ is not harmed that bad. I can use it w/o any serious problems. I opened this Issue just to have a starting point. Just to collect data about those crashes. May other users experience the same and we can find anything in common or anything being not related (e.g. Hardware?).

comment.body:
Closing, no solution. 
I just havn't had that issue since quite a while and in future I wont use OTX companion any longer.

issue.title: X9D+ SE 2019 and multimodule communication cut off with SF switch when openTX >= 2.3.12
issue.body:
Hi, 

I have a Taranis X9D+ SE 2019 (openTX 2.3.14) and an iRangeX IRX4+ multimodule (firmware 1.3.6)
I'm facing a fairly critical issue of communication cut off between radio and module.

In serial mode (MULTI), communication between the radio and the multimodule cuts off under reproducible circumstances as follows :

- receiver doesn't need to be on (though problem may appear quicker when receiver is on, but not sure of this point)
- after several toggles of the 2-positions switch SF (random number of toggles, that can be one or ten, rarely more than a few tens) the communication between the radio and the multimodule cuts off (the radio says "No serial input" and the red led flashes slowly on the multimodule)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9478418/143895294-a130a1f3-ba6e-49ca-9fd3-125d161386b2.png)

I posted this issue to RC Groups thread and it appears that this is not an isolated case, it seems to be related to using multimodule inside X9D+ SE 2019, please [see here](https://www.rcgroups.com/forums/showpost.php?p=48240461&postcount=23142).

[Old openTX versions](https://www.rcgroups.com/forums/showpost.php?p=48249615&postcount=23150) for X9D+ SE 2019 have been posted on the same thread so I could try and see if issue is still there.

Here are the results of my tests : 
- openTX 2.3.13 : issue is present
- openTX 2.3.12 : issue is present
- openTX 2.3.11 : no issue detected
- openTX 2.3.10 : no issue detected
- openTX <= 2.3.9 : not tested

So it seems to me that the issue appeared with openTX 2.3.12 and is there since.

Thanks for your help. Best regards.

Remark : no issue with another switch than SF, no issue with PPM communication mode, no issue with SF switch when using internal RF, no issue with an X9D, seems specific to X9D+ SE 2019 + multimodule + serial mode + SF switch

In serial mode (MULTI), communication between the radio and the multimodule cuts off under reproducible circumstances as follows :
- radio is using external RF 
- communication between radio and module is set in serial mode (MULTI)
- receiver doesn't need to be on (though problem may appear quicker when receiver is on, but not sure of this point)
- after several toggles of the 2-positions switch SF (random number of toggles, that can be one or ten, rarely more than a few tens) the communication between the radio and the multimodule cuts off (the radio says "No serial input" and the red led flashes slowly on the multimodule)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9478418/143895294-a130a1f3-ba6e-49ca-9fd3-125d161386b2.png)

I posted this issue to RC Groups thread and it appears that this is not an isolated case, it seems to be related to using multimodule inside X9D+ SE 2019, please [see here](https://www.rcgroups.com/forums/showpost.php?p=48240461&postcount=23142).

[Old openTX versions](https://www.rcgroups.com/forums/showpost.php?p=48249615&postcount=23150) for X9D+ SE 2019 have been posted on the same thread so I could try and see if issue is still there.

Here are the results of my tests : 
- openTX 2.3.13 : issue is present
- openTX 2.3.12 : issue is present
- openTX 2.3.11 : no issue detected
- openTX 2.3.10 : no issue detected
- openTX <= 2.3.9 : not tested

So it seems to me that the issue appeared with openTX 2.3.12 and is there since.

Thanks for your help. Best regards.

Remark : no issue with another switch than SF, no issue with PPM communication mode, no issue with SF switch when using internal RF, no issue with an X9D, seems specific to X9D+ SE 2019 + multimodule + serial mode + SF switch

comment.body:
Good point about that combination not too frequently occurring, but neither bsongis nor 3djc could duplicate the problem.

Installing the firmware is no problem, that's what you do when you upgrade.  Setting up a build environment is another story.  Seeing if the problem exists in edgeTX would be interesting.

issue.title: X9D+ SE 2019 and multimodule communication cut off with SF switch when openTX >= 2.3.12
issue.body:
Hi, 

I have a Taranis X9D+ SE 2019 (openTX 2.3.14) and an iRangeX IRX4+ multimodule (firmware 1.3.6)
I'm facing a fairly critical issue of communication cut off between radio and module.

In serial mode (MULTI), communication between the radio and the multimodule cuts off under reproducible circumstances as follows :
- radio is using external RF 
- communication between radio and module is set in serial mode (MULTI)
- receiver doesn't need to be on (though problem may appear quicker when receiver is on, but not sure of this point)
- after several toggles of the 2-positions switch SF (random number of toggles, that can be one or ten, rarely more than a few tens) the communication between the radio and the multimodule cuts off (the radio says "No serial input" and the red led flashes slowly on the multimodule)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9478418/143895294-a130a1f3-ba6e-49ca-9fd3-125d161386b2.png)

I posted this issue to RC Groups thread and it appears that this is not an isolated case, it seems to be related to using multimodule inside X9D+ SE 2019, please [see here](https://www.rcgroups.com/forums/showpost.php?p=48240461&postcount=23142).

[Old openTX versions](https://www.rcgroups.com/forums/showpost.php?p=48249615&postcount=23150) for X9D+ SE 2019 have been posted on the same thread so I could try and see if issue is still there.

Here are the results of my tests : 
- openTX 2.3.13 : issue is present
- openTX 2.3.12 : issue is present
- openTX 2.3.11 : no issue detected
- openTX 2.3.10 : no issue detected
- openTX <= 2.3.9 : not tested

So it seems to me that the issue appeared with openTX 2.3.12 and is there since.

Thanks for your help. Best regards.

Remark : no issue with another switch than SF, no issue with PPM communication mode, no issue with SF switch when using internal RF, no issue with an X9D, seems specific to X9D+ SE 2019 + multimodule + serial mode + SF switch

comment.body:
Git bisect does a binary search for the bad commit given a good and bad starting point.  It checks out  commit half way between the good and bad.  You compile and test it and tell git bisect if it is good or bad.  It then checks out one half way again and again you compile and test it.  This continues until you find the exact commit that caused the problem  On first run bisect tells you how many iterations it may take to isolate the problem.

The down side is that you must to be able to compile the firmware and test it to find the commit that caused the problem and it may take 8 or 10 iterations which would be time consuming.

The other problem is that there must be thousands of those transmitters and only a couple of you are having the problem and evidently no one that can compile the firmware has the problem.  This seems to indicate that the problem must be some kind of race condition between the firmware and some specific piece of hardware of the (very few) failing units, or possibly hardware modifications of the failing units (I think at least some of them have had switches moved or other changes) and if that is the case just changing the build environment may change the problem.

comment.body: If you know that 2.3.11 is good and 2.3.12 is bad and can build the firmware "git bisect" will find the exact commit that caused the problem.  Then you can look to see what changed in that commit.
